reviewText: I wish they made feminist films this daring today! Love it or hate it, you won't forget it.

This film provocatively portrays the plight of women in the patriarchal world.  As a female psychiatrist attempts to discover the motive for a horrible crime, she bonds with the three women accused.  At the same time, her relationship to her "liberal" husband goes through an interesting (I could say, predictable) transformation.  The movie is carefully paced so that we investigate along with the psychiatrist right up the stunning ending.  Since the film is subtitled, one might want to wear earplugs for the soundtrack may drive you crazy with its "techno-music" sound and beat.  Truly, this is a film that becomes more and more relevant every day; why it has never been released on DVD is beyond me.

I hope that this will make it to DVD so I can watch it again.  It made a big impression on me when I watched it fifteen years ago as a single college student, and I was wondering how I would react to it this time as a mom of two boys, mid-divorce.  I'm so curious, I almost think I might get it and watch it at a friend's house.  It's sad to me that great movies like this might stop being viewed and talked about, now that it can't make the online rental queues.

I warn you, that probably no men will "get" this movie, and some women won't either.  The amazing thing about this movie is that you're either in on the joke or you're not.  The joke is dark, not funny.  It's about being able to appreciate a point of view.
This film always provides for lively and controversial conversation. It's an amazing examination of the relationship between the sexes. Highly recommended.
